segments.text: I see the water from the sink just pouring onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's creating such a big puddle, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying her dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how oblivious she is to the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with their cookies to notice the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit annoyed that no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just flowing down the cabinets, making everything wet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the floor is slippery now because of the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's really bothering me how no one is reacting to this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and tell them to look at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I guess they'll notice eventually, hopefully before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
